item.title: Report E-2025020414
item.description:
Report E-2025020414

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-27T15:24:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-27
  • City: FLORENCE
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 02/27/2025, at 13:04 hours, CSXT personnel in the Florence Yard (Florence, SC) discovered TILX282086, a loaded tank car of Ethylene Glycol, leaking from top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Sabic, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report 2025-0227-00169). HEPACO, a CSXT response contractor, responded and found that six of six manway cover bolts were less than tool tight. Contractor personnel were able to secure five of the manway bolts but found the sixth manway bolt was stripped and unable to be tightened. The card was held pending further repair by a certified tank car repair shop. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipperâ€™s representative- Moustafa Mughrabi (713-430-2501).

item.title: Report E-2025030297
item.description:
Report E-2025030297

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-26T21:14:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-18
  • City: LEXINGTON
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: EAGLE TRANSPORT CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Eagle driver turned right on red at a double right turn lane. Other truck was on the inside turn lane and swung into ETC lane. Other truck stopped but Eagle trailer made contact with other tractor. Small release of less than 10 gals of gas spilled from wetlines on trailer. The product cleaned by the fire department.
